snippet: Five years after a financial crisis in the United States helped spread a deep global recession, much of the world again fears collateral damage.
abstract: Bitter fiscal stalemate in Washington is producing nervous ripples worldwide, with increasing anxiety that United States might actually default on its government debt, setting off global financial troubles; many foreign observers fear collateral damage from US political system that to their eyes no longer seems to be able to function efficiently.
lead_paragraph: Five years after a financial crisis in the United States helped spread a deep global recession, much of the world again fears collateral damage.

headline.main: Default Threat Generates Fear Around Globe
headline.print_headline: Default Threat Generates Fear Around Globe
